The false caption: The expert's verdict highlights that the claim includes a false caption stating that the woman in the middle of the picture is Mrs. May and the woman on the right is Mrs. Grybauskaitė. This aspect of the claim is considered inauthentic.
Image analysis: The expert's verdict mentions that the woman in the middle of the picture does not resemble Mrs. May. By comparing the image to verified pictures of Mrs. May from her youth, it is concluded that the woman in the middle is not her. This aspect contributes to the determination of the claim's inauthenticity.
Lack of resemblance: The expert's verdict also notes that the woman on the right of the picture does not resemble Mrs. Grybauskaitė. While there may not be a verified picture of Mrs. Grybauskaitė from the same time period, the evidence suggests that the teenager in the photograph is not her. This aspect supports the conclusion that the claim is not authentic.
Confirmation from the Lithuanian Embassy: Although not explicitly mentioned in the expert's verdict, it is stated that the Lithuanian Embassy in London confirmed that the woman on the right of the picture is not Mrs. Grybauskaitė. This confirmation adds further weight to the determination that the claim is false.
